website_summaries.verdict: Durable and versatile, this rocker features a gap in the middle that lets you use it for ankle strengthening, too.
pros: Motion of foot rocker stretches foot to relieve pain, reduce fatigue, and improve circulation
Raised heel plate locks heel into place  while in use
Mid-foot gap lets you use for ankle strengthening
cons: May slide if you use it on carpet

customer_reviews.title: Ten Toes UP!  Seriously, get this if you have PF!
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit it -- I'm lazy about doing my floor/wall exercises for PF. And then I suffer because of my laziness. And then I found this thing. How did I not know about foot rockers before? This thing is amazing -- quicker than rolling a towel, easier than sitting on the floor, and really fun to use. Just be sure to wear shoes (the box has a picture of someone using it barefoot, which is almost as silly as wearing 99-cent flip-flops.) Having never used one before, let me say that it feels immensely sturdy, and would probably hold a wide range of sizes of sneakered/tennis-shoed feet. If you have PF, you NEED THIS in your life.
customer_reviews.author: Trillion

customer_reviews.title: WORKED FOR ME!
customer_reviews.text: I came down with a great case of plantar fasciitis, and a friend who is physical therapist said "it's about stretching out that calf muscle!" Rather than go through the usual stretching contortions in the hope of focusing in on the calves, I started looking at these kinds of devices. All I can say is: This one is easy to use, is also good for hamstrings and other potentially troublesome muscles that need stretching in order to avoid problems (especially as one ages...). I used it daily and my plantar troubles were gone within a couple of weeks. I don't know if other such devices work better, but this one gets a 100% rating from this aging being.
customer_reviews.author: Honest American Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR DEEEEEPPP STRETCHING!
customer_reviews.text: I have Achilles tendinitis and plantar fasciitis and this is the PERFECT tool for a deep stretch. I do yoga and stretch like it’s my job, but I can never quite get those soleus muscles to relax. If you have extremely tight calves, or medical conditions like myself this is definitely for you. It’s also great for a hamstring and glut stretch! Mix this deep stretch a couple times a day with yoga and medical massage and hopefully you will start to feel better! Love the price and it’s sturdy enough to get your stretch on without worrying about it cracking in half!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: I have been stretching the calf for a couple of years as part of my routine and this device feels good to the hamstring as well
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a foot stretcher in PT after an ankle fusion. I do not usually write reviews, but couldn't help it with this product. Mine came with a life time guarantee, booklet, $5.00 offer and unadvertised free product. It works just as well as the one I use at PT, but half the price. I have been stretching the calf for a couple of years as part of my routine and this device feels good to the hamstring as well. Extremely pleased!
customer_reviews.author: TBO

customer_reviews.title: Worth Trying!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband who has plantar fasciitis. My husband stated that this helps to lessen the pain and he is able to walk with less discomfort. He also really likes using the spikey massage ball that the seller included with the stretcher (and is much appreciated). The combination has really made a difference for him. I also use the foot rocker for when I am bothered by a tightness in my ankle that pops up from time to time. It does help to stretch out the muscle. My foot will sometimes slip a little when using it, but overall it's pretty secure.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job.  Wide.  Non-slip.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. It's wider than most that I've used in gyms and the physio's. And I love the non-slip on the bottom although that's the only part that can improve slightly; it could be a little more tacky but not enough to take a star off. I have a size 6 foot and can use it with or without shoes. My son has a size 11 foot and he prefers to use it with shoes. He says that without shoes, the back digs into his heels a bit. But the instructions clearly state to wear shoes. So there you have it.
customer_reviews.author: Meemo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Stretch for your aching feet
customer_reviews.text: Buy this, even if you don't think you need it, believe me, you do! Both hubby and I have been using it since it arrived, you get a nice deep stretch, more so than hanging off the edge of a step (which works but not quite the same.) What I love about the rocker is you control the level of stretch and the timing. We have both had plantar fasciiitis, this rocker helps, immensely. It is well built, it has control strips underneath which helps it grip and keeps it from sliding, there's no size foot it can't handle, you just bring your heel to the end of the heel cup and rock and stretch. Very easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Did nothing for my plantar fasciitis. Did not help with over probation at all.
customer_reviews.author: autumn

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: It is very dangerous to use if you are not very careful - I fell - my foot slipped out and I thought for sure I broke my arm. Wow, I was scared, but fortunately, I was ok. I did have to return, it was not worth the risk - I very easily could have fallen on my head!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Moore

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This did absolutely nothing for me. I can get a better and deeper stretch from using my porch stairs. This didn't help me whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Carlito's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: This stretcher is too unstable for safety reasons. You need to be well balanced and have something sturdy to hold onto if you use this product. Not recommended for anyone that is mature in age.
customer_reviews.author: Dale L Van Ness

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Where were these?! I wish I had discovered them years ago! If you have Plantar Faciitis problems, these are excellent an will give you some relief. They are like standing on a stair exercise when you don't have a stair to stand on. I might purchase a second one to keep at work.
customer_reviews.author: BosMoM

customer_reviews.title: foot rocker is a bad deal gone wrong
customer_reviews.text: foot rocker is a good idea -poorly executed.the length of rocker roll determinens the angle of rotation which should be centered over arch. with a big foot angleis centered too far back. Amazon website won't accept return spent too much wiil have too eat my rocker or use it for door stop..
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: so have been looking for equipment that I can utilize for the stretching of my feet to insure ease while on the court- a lot of players have pain in their feetThe Vive foot stretcher is an excellent product -and with the instructions I am able to ...
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid tennis player, so have been looking for equipment that I can utilize for the stretching of my feet to insure ease while on the court- a lot of players have pain in their feetThe Vive foot stretcher is an excellent product -and with the instructions I am able to stretch my foot out as this mechanism provides ease .... it's a fun machine and you feel like it's doing something good for your feet in the way of providing flexibility - I am comforted to know that after my exercises my feet actually feel better ...with plantar fasciitis pain you need this machine
customer_reviews.author: cclarke......

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected but still good
customer_reviews.text: The person in the picture must have a tiny foot because barefoot my toes go right to the edge and in my shoe I go way over, I am a size 13 BTW. But it is big enough and the traction ridges on it are comfortable even in bare feet, which is more than I can say for some of the other ones I've tried. Seems to be a very sturdy contraction and really the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it is much smaller than what is presented by the picture,
customer_reviews.author: Thomasaleeds

customer_reviews.title: Do this at home and reduce recovery time and pain.
customer_reviews.text: I broke both my tibia and fibula at the ankle. After the cast was removed, all my Doctor kept telling me was that recovery and physical therapy will hurt more than the brake itself. My Physical Therapist recommended this device to continue stretching at home. It really helps to stretch as much as possible for both pain and movement.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon B.

customer_reviews.title: This one however is perfect for bigger feet
customer_reviews.text: I have used something similar before in a Physical Therapist office, however, it was different and it actually hurt my foot. This one however is perfect for bigger feet, like me. It will fit all sizes. I leave in a common area and use it 4-5 times a day. My plantar fasciitis is already improving. This is my 4th time with PF in my life, so far. I think I will continue to use this product daily and see if I can cure it....or keep it at bay. I would recommend this and love it, it fits big feet for sure!!!!
customer_reviews.author: TinT

customer_reviews.title: you get a deeper stretch
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 injections in my left foot for plantar fasciitis within a 7 week period this year 2018. My podiatrist told me to stretch my calves and ice my foot because I still complained about the pain. The foot rocker helps achieve a deeper stretch in the calves and hamstrings. I use the foot rocker twice a day because my calves and hamstrings are tight! You would probably not realize how tight your muscles are until you use the foot rocker. Oh yeah, I use it while standing up with my hands on the wall. I also, bend forward to get a deeper stretch.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Helped my plantar faciitis
customer_reviews.text: They used this at my physical therapy office and I wish I would've bought it sooner. I've been suffering from plantar fasciitis for four months and have tried everything (physical therapy, astym, dry needling, stretching, yoga). But the pain kept getting wares. After the first day of owning this it has helped a lot. The pain in my arch has decreased tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Marie C

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims, half the price of the leading brand
customer_reviews.text: This works just the same as the name brand (ProStretch). It is a little small, though. It fits my husband's feet barefoot, and he is a size 10. If he wears his shoes, it would be too small. Also, I recommend getting those heel padding things for shoes and sticking it to the back of this if you plan to use it barefoot. The plastic is very hard and rough on the back of the heel. I prefer to use this barefoot because I get a better stretch for my plantaris as well as simultaneously my achilles tendon. There is absolutely no reason to spend twice the price on the ProStretch. This is exactly the same.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey T.G

customer_reviews.title: STURDY and well made.  Makes stretching calves simple & easy.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it will last a lifetime. Easy to slide under the bed; I use it in evening before going bed. Has helped almost eliminate, my RLS, which strikes at night. I also take Mag 64 or Slo-Mag (m. chloride) as necessary & 'THERAworx Relief', which is mag. sulphate.(Important to pick right form of magnesium; not all types work for cramps/RLS.) I've had no cramps either since I started using this device. Stretching your leg muscles is really important.
customer_reviews.author: Praxa

customer_reviews.title: He said the stretching part is good but with out shoes the edges hurt his feet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my hubby. He said the stretching part is good but with out shoes the edges hurt his feet. He would like it better if it had a small about of padding in some areas. It works much better with out shoes. This would be the only small change. But for the price its good.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Work great to stretch my achilles tendons
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Work great to stretch my achilles tendons. 3 set of 15 reps at AM and 3 set of 15 reps at PM. Do it fore 3 or 6 months to get rid of achilles tendinitis.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best!!
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best!!! I had very tight calf muscles and plantar fasciitis. Since I began using this gem daily, my calf tightness and feet ailments are GONE!! It’s the best purchase I’ve made in a long time!! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much worthless if you have a Larger Foot
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product and it seems sturdy and a well made piece of plastic. Unfortunately the mechanics of it don't work for a larger foot. I am a male size 12.5 shoe. My foot barely fits and doesn't work to stretch my achilles tendonitis problem. I am much better off simply using a set of stairs and a handrail. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: E. Mathewson

customer_reviews.title: I Could Not be Happier
customer_reviews.text: I had/have plantar and have had it for a couple of months. I tried the sleep boot (helped a little), ice (helped a little) and the golf ball massage (painful, and helped a little). My doctor declined a cortisone shot, since it was just mask the issue. And, inserts are terribly expensive, so I thought I'd give this a chance before the inserts. I did the stretch routine 3x a day, and a week later, I feel so much better. Not all gone, but close. I recommend it wholeheartedly. A small investment gives a lot of pain relief.
customer_reviews.author: lmzrsk

customer_reviews.title: It stretches the calf really nicely to help relieve Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: This product does just what it's described to do! It stretches the calf really nicely to help relieve Plantar Fasciitis. I was suprised and delighted to find my package even came with a spikey massage roll, which feel very nice in conjunction with the stretch. The paper packaging was attractive and I was happy it was so easily recyclable. Would definitely look into other items from Vive!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Foot Doesn't fit Rocker
customer_reviews.text: The picture shows the foot fitting comfortably on the rocker, this must have been a child's foot, as my size 9 inch foot overhangs the rocker by more then an inch and is completely useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: Foot drop and tight calves no more! 🤗
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS calf stretcher! I have MS, and it affects my right side; as a result my right calf is always tight, and I have foot drop. I bought this as I didn’t want to use a leg brace, and wow, it has done wonders for my foot drop! Best of all, it’s so easy to use! Even my boyfriend who happens to be a personal trainer and his brother love it 😊. Such a simple tool that makes such a big impact!
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Great for PF/ Achilles Tendonitis issues
customer_reviews.text: This footrocker really helps with my plantar fasciitis bilateral and achilles tendonitis issues. Came in great condition I highly recommend this product. Also came with this little gray foot stretcher great for plantar fasciitis and foot pain
customer_reviews.author: Francia TALTON

customer_reviews.title: amazing and rock solid!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted one of these forever, since I first used one all those years ago at a chiropractic office. As a teenager I was obsessed with stretching, I would drop my heels on every curb or drop into splits on any slippery store floor! Then I got a job in a cubicle and now I'm fat and lazy haha so my calves are tight, my feet have planter factitious, and a world of other issues. I finally broke down and bought this calf stretcher and I got to say I'm impressed! It is rock solid and heavy and I really love this! I hope I can get back to stretching like the old days!
customer_reviews.author: AnnieB

customer_reviews.title: Didn't recieve the massage ball
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my plantar fasciitis and it really does help. Make sure you use this with your shoe on or it can be uncomfortable. I used it and noticed a difference in just 2 days. My plantar fasciitis isn't gone after 2 days, but I really do have less heel and foot pain. The reason I give it 3 stars and not more is this...the rocker works great and it gets 4 or 5 stars, however, I never got the massage ball that everyone else seems to have recieved. It may sound silly but I was looking forward to trying it.
customer_reviews.author: Beeswax

customer_reviews.title: Great stretch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stretcher for my calves. I remember having one when i worked at a PT office and how helpful it was so i decided to buy one for our house. My calves are notoriously tight and i find it hard to stretch them properly so this helps out immensely. I wish it was a little more comfortable without shoes on. The way the plastic is, it is somewhat painful on the heel to try to use it without shoes. But either way, it gives a good stretch.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: It produces results!!
customer_reviews.text: Broke my right foot in two places 18 months ago. Developed RSD (CRPS) and plantar fasciitis as a result of injury. After a slight back injury, physical therapist addressed my foot as well. I used the clinic's foot rocker for both feet...game changer for right foot! I ordered one the next day. Foot is better than it's been in 18 mo, the swelling has greatly improved and the lack of stability in my ankle/foot has improved tremendously. This has been an answer to my prayers. Pain relief, stabilization and strength is increasingly improving! Very THANKFUL! Hoping this works it's way up to my back!!!
customer_reviews.author: ShelleyBean

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but the enclosed instructions are not the best
customer_reviews.text: I've got a real problem with cramps in my calves at night, so I bought this to stretch them out when that happens (and, hopefully before that happens). It's sturdy and solid, and it does what it's supposed to do. However, the enclosed instructions could be much better. I didn't get this to work for me until I watched some videos of how some similar stretchers are used. After that, it's fine. I also suggest (and the manufacturer does too) that you wear a sturdy shoe when you use this - not just for the sole of your foot, but also for the back of your heel, which can take quite a beating if you don't protect it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Surprised results
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this would help with my PF but I was surprised. After a couple of uses I started noticing the pain was not as strong. Now it has been about a week and the pain has reduced about 75%. My doctor had advised to do stretches with my foot and this is what I needed. I would purchase again if needed but this thing is very sturdy and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyNash

customer_reviews.title: Product Warning: "make sure to wear flat, rubber sole shoes"
customer_reviews.text: The Vive Foot Rocker seems pretty sturdy and works fine with my size 9 bedroom slippers, sticking over about 1/2 inch, and size 9.5 hiking shoes, sticking over about 1-1/2 inches. The foot massage ball that comes with the rocker, in my opinion, is too large at 2.8 inches. I much prefer the 1.8 inch ball from Fleet Feet, though a bit pricy at $10. Interestingly, the carton that the rocker ships with shows the rocker being used barefoot, but the user guide warns to use a flat, rubber soled shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Mackerel Bob

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Before getting this I don't think I was ever properly stretching my calves; and I worked as a personal trainer for 2 years! I try to be good about using it everyday but I use it manly before/after work (ICU nurse so long shifts on my feet). It gives a great stretch and would highly recommend for anyone with sore feet! Tight calves contribute heavily to sore feet. The ball it comes with is basically one of those balls you throw in the dryer with your clothes to cut drying time. I never would have thought to roll one of those under my feet but if they help with sore fascia sure I'll give it a go!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my mother
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mother, who has been taking daily walks and started complaining of heal pain. I immediately suspected that she was suffering from a touch of planters fasciitis. I advised her to not call the podiatrist and to try a couple of things first. I brought her over a foam roller and this foot rocker. I showed her how to effectively roll and stretch her calves. Magically, with in a week her heal pain was gone!! More impressive than how effective this protocol works, is the fact that my mother listened to me and followed my advice. Go figure...
customer_reviews.author: Gerald McDermott

customer_reviews.title: The Deep Stretch Rocker For Achilles and Plantar Pain
customer_reviews.text: I have persistent Achilles tendonitis, and plantar fasciitis. I have done stretching exercises prescribed by my Orthopedic specialist, with minimal relief, due to recent carpal tunnel, and rotator cuff surgery. Since I am unable to hold my stretches for long, I purchased, the Vive Foot Rocker. Now I can stretch easier and for a longer duration. I not only get relief with the deep stretch for my foot, and calf, I also get to stretch my hamstrings. I like that it is one solid piece, with no parts to put together. The foot plate is one size that will fit most. I absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: catnan

customer_reviews.title: ) The product itself was quite sturdy and worked fine
customer_reviews.text: This worked as advertised but it really causes a lot of pain to actually do it! Because of that, I didn't use it much. Considered returning it but it cost so much in shipping to return, that I just kept the item. Hopefully when my plantar fasciitis calms down it will be easier to do (but then, I won't really need it as much will I?) The product itself was quite sturdy and worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sue M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Stretch for the Back of the Leg
customer_reviews.text: This product does provide a great leg stretch. I have chronic calf tightness and the Foot Rocker has helped relieve the pain I was feeling. It stretches the entire back of the leg ( Achilles, calf, hamstring) which is a must. You need to stretch all of these muscles in unison to get lasting relief. I have had it for only a week and find it a bit awkward to use, but I’m figuring out the best way to use it. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: GJ Nashville, TN

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by 2 Physical Therapy Clinics
customer_reviews.text: I had to go to physical therapy a couple of times for foot problems. They felt my tight calves were part of the problem, so they had me do all sorts of stretches to my calves. They had this device at both clinics and they like to use them. I ended up getting one for home and one for the office. I keep them under my desks and stretch my calves throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Gochnauer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I had a Jones Fracture on my right foot and needed a rocker to stretch my arch and Achilles’ tendon. I really like the size and weight of the Vive Foot Rocker. I wear a size 81/2 running shoe, so this works great. I usually like to use it without shoes, so I added a foam piece to pad the heel section. I had originally ordered a wooden foot rocker, but the length was too long and it was too heavy. This rocker works perfect for me! I also really like the ball that is included with the rocker! Works great for massaging my foot!
customer_reviews.author: Lei

customer_reviews.title: Works!  Helps!
customer_reviews.text: I already had one of these and bought this one to go with it. Works great! And now I can do both feet/legs at the same time. Stretches my lower legs out really nice. It's definately a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Granny Annie

customer_reviews.title: Not for larger feet
customer_reviews.text: “The foot rocker can be used for feet of any size.” I copied that from the description of this product because that’s why I bought it. I should have looked at the pictures to find the other unlucky big footed guy who bought it. I’m a size 16 and all my toes hang off the end. My shoe makes it worse. It is unusable for me. It’d probably work for men’s size 10 and under, but I can’t confirm that. It is very sturdy. If you use it with socks, your feet will slide off. There is texture on it but it won’t grip socks at all.
customer_reviews.author: duff

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I was just released from physical therapy for my ankle last week. I used something similar in PT. This device is clumsy and hard to use. I can’t get my foot in the right place to stretch out the areas I need to strengthen the ankle. Doesn’t give me the range of stretching that I was hoping for. I have to keep up the strength of my ankle so I can keep from falling when I get up from sitting. I have fallen 3 times breaking the cuboid bone twice and the fifth metatarsal once. I am desperately looking for things that will keep my ankle strong. This does not fill the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Catsagt

customer_reviews.title: Stretch
customer_reviews.text: This order arrived on time. Although I have had it only a few days, it has helped with stretching. Plantar fasciitis isn’t fun. Between this gizmo and a frozen water bottle, And the ball, some relief. I do recommend wearing a tennis shoe when using this product and stand up. The ball that comes with it is great! While it looks like a medieval torture device, it actually has some give to it and the spikes feel good on the feet. For this ball, I usually sit and roll it under my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Holly K

customer_reviews.title: I ended up returning this item.....
customer_reviews.text: because I found it difficult to use. I can use a wall or tree easier.....and have the same effect. I need to strengthen my calves so it is really hard to use this and feel as if I am safe teetering on one foot while getting into position. Just didn't work for me. Don't think there is anything wrong with it necessarily.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great product- recommended by a calf stretching veteran
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased one of these from another, better known, brand. I bought this item one for use at work. It works very well and full met my expectations. The stretcher is sturdy and stable. It also has anti-skid features that make it better than the previous one I had purchased. On a back to back basis, this stretcher has slightly less range of motion compared to my first one (the blue one- if that gives you a hint as to which one I previously purchased). However, the range of motion is more than adequate for providing safe calf stretching. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott F.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for about 3 weeks now and my Plantar Fasciitis is finally starting to get better. For months I’ve been using the “stretch your toes back” devices and they really didn’t help at all. The medical community seems to think PF is Caused by tight calf muscles so it makes sense that this rocker would be helpful. Also the spiky ball that comes with it is also great for loosening up the tightness that’s especially prevalent in the mornings. All in all five plus stars for both items!
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Get it! Now!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been dealing with plantar fasciitis problems (self diagnosed) for over 4 months now and have tried various remedies to help with the discomfort. After googling more remedies, it seemed my tight calves could be part of the problem. So once the product arrived, I was very eager to try it. After the first day of use (combined with ice therapy), I barely felt any discomfort! I’m almost pain and truly believe this product is the reason! I’ll continue to use this product as part of my wellness routine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Warm-up and stretching the calves and ankles
customer_reviews.text: My ankles and calves used to pain during the first 15 to 20 mins of the runs. My therapist recommended ankle and calf warmup before the runs; this stretcher reduced the warmup time drastically. It is really good at quickly warming up my ankles and calves. I do 10 reps forward and 10 reps backward for the warmup. The stretcher is made out of strong plastic with rubber strips on the bottom for use on hardwood floors. You need to wear footwear to use this as the surface is pretty hard.
customer_reviews.author: Vignesh

customer_reviews.title: Foot slid around too much
customer_reviews.text: This was not the right product for my husband and I. Our foot slid around too much to get a proper stretch. We both tried various shoes and then mailed it back. It was not usable for us. It is hard plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: I own two of these...they're amazing!
customer_reviews.text: We have one at home...and I have one at the office at my standing desk and, this is going to sound weird, I don't think I could live without one of these now. They are simply amazing. As a snowboarder, these are amazing to get your calfs limber and strong for the upcoming season. Spending 2-3 minutes a day, total, stretching out your calves goes SUCH a long way! Not to mention, that if you change up your stance you can also stretch your hamstring as well! I cannot recommend enough!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Despite my skepticism , this really works!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I had to move and we did much of the move ourselves, other than furniture. I had been suffering from suffering from plantar fasciitis and really worried about being on my feet all day for many days while we moved things back and forth. I read that it probably was my calves causing the issue and then I found the Vive Foot Rocker. Between stretching with it a couple of times a day and the move I feel very little pain in my foot now. It is actually healing despite the massive amount of work it took to complete the move. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jen&Phil

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: After ONE use I noticed a huge difference in how my calfs/legs felt. I use it before and after my 2 mile, very hilly, walk and my legs feel soooooo much better now. The tightness and soreness is gone. It came with a little spiked ball that you roll around with your foot that gets rid of all that arch ache too. Best $17.50 I've ever spent
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great stretch
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this calf stretcher. I've had plantar fasciitis, tibial tendonitis and tight calves for a long time. This has helped tremendously. Lean forward a little into the stretch and I can feel the stretch all the way up to my glutes. Very sturdy and stable.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonders against my plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I was ordered to do stretches due to plantar fasciitis, the doc recommended getting a plastic car wheel wedge (!) to use against the wall. This seemed a bit easier to use. You just have to make sure to use it with a sturdy shoe. I noticed a significant improvement after just a few days, it provides a nice, controlled deep stretch.
customer_reviews.author: Kat J

customer_reviews.title: Stretching my calves after knee replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could have one in my office and people come in and use it because they love it too! Sturdy and absolutely does what I need it to do in stretching out my calves and straightening my knee after replacement surgery. The bottom has material on it that prevents slipping and so you can feel very reassured that you won't go flying off as you put weight on your foot. Its a must have for anyone who cares about their calves.
customer_reviews.author: BOJO1507

customer_reviews.title: Much deeper stretch
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Much deeper stretch than off a stair step or against the wall. Helps alot before running and helped my knee pain too!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa D.

customer_reviews.title: It hurts so good!
customer_reviews.text: This rocker thing is fantastic. Don't get me wrong it hurts, a whole lot. Like A LOT. But that's the point, right? To stretch that damn calf so your foot hurts less. I've been using it a couple times a day and my foot feels at least 70% better.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Excellent foot rocker
customer_reviews.text: I love how light weight, yet durable this rocker is! I am recovering from a lumbar discectomy and nerve damage/drop foot and this rocker really helps to stretch my affected leg out. I was introduced to the foot rocker at physical therapy and it really does help create a greater range of motion than I could do using other objects to press my foot up against, and even greater range than I can produce with a strap.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel B

customer_reviews.title: deeper stretch
customer_reviews.text: I'm thrilled with this Pro Flexer. I've had plantar fasciitis for 4 months now, and this has allowed a better stretch than almost anything I've tried. I am planning on getting a 2nd so I can have one upstairs and downstairs! The only room for improvement would be some sort of cushion against the back/heel cup. When making a deep stretch while barefoot, it is a little uncomfortable against the hard plastic. It doesn't hinder the stretch, however, and can easily be used with socks OR shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Leif Busby

customer_reviews.title: Quick stretch
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a while, both before and after biking multiple times a week and it has helped my calf muscles relax after being heavily used for a while. I recommend this for anyone who is short on space and has no stairs or other sharp incline surface that they can stretch their calf muscles on. This is absolutely one of my favorite pieces of stretching equipment! Have your shoes on while using this, or you could slip off and it may be a bit painful on your feet.
customer_reviews.author: EnjoyLife

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and uncomfortable, but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: What can I say... it's a piece of hard plastic in the right shape. It's totally overpriced at $20, but it gets the job done as long as you're wearing sneakers. A simple design improvement would be a soft padding at the back, where it touches the heel. That's where it hurts if you try to use it without sneakers (as I do 99% of the time). Bottom line: get the cheapest model you can find on Amazon, it's just a piece of plastic, I doubt it'll make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Ademar Reis

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like one of those products that is going to work no matter. The plastic is durable and the non-slip material on the bottom works well. Out of everything that might fail would be the non-slip material. However, this seems to be designed to last on this product. It seem as if this is also plastic coated with non-slip material. It not a cheap sticker. Therefore, I would guess this will last.
customer_reviews.author: Theo Espinosa

customer_reviews.title: I suffer from Plantar Fasciitis Pain, Podiatrist recommended this type of unit to help
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from Plantar Fasciitis Pain, went to my Podiatrist who recommended I purchase this (and use it) to stretch. Works easily and following the daily exercises it relieved the constant pain I had in my heal. Works with or without shoe or socks. Small and simple design makes it easy to leave out and use (rather than put away daily and forget.) I'm a satisfied user now.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell BellTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Best calf stretching device due to how strong it is, huge range of motion and does its job!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic range of motion to stretch my calfs. An foot injury has left my foot immobile to move outward, only inward-like touching toes. The foot rockers works so great that I am getting a little more foot range of motion. And better balance. I was using something similar to what is used in physical theropy centers. If I only knew they were available, I would have bought it years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Donna M. B.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I don't think there is anything wrong or bad about this item, it just didn't work for me. It really dug into the back of my heel, so it was uncomfortable. And, I'm fairly flexible already, so the range of motion wasn't quite enough. I have better luck using a hand towel, and will probably just continue doing that. For someone with bigger feet, it might work better. It's very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Great foot rocker for stretching!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for stretching. I have plantar fasciitis and was not getting enough stretching in at home. Now I use this in the morning before work and at night too and am able to stretch properly at home. I highly recommend this product and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to have flexible shoes to use this.
customer_reviews.text: If you have really messed up feet and pretty much only own Danskos ( or other orthotic shoes) this won't work ( or you will have to buy a pair of flexible shoes to use when you use this). I purchased it to use underneath my desk at work, so when my shoes would not bend enough to fit into the rocker I had to return it, because it stresses that shoes must be worn when using the rocker.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Brown House

customer_reviews.title: Definitely working for my PF
customer_reviews.text: I have been dealing with PF for months. For the last month I've tried foot rollers, sleep braces and stretches. They all helped a little, but this foot rocker/ calf stretcher works better than them all. Within 2 days (30 secs of stretching per leg, 3 or 4 times a day, or whenever I felt the pain) I was going longer without pain. Normally, I was feeling it an hour into my day (on my feet all day at work), but after 5 days with this device, I'm going almost to the end of my shift before the pain gets too bad. Hoping to be completely rid of PF in a few weeks. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: D.W.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product!!!! There were 2 things I really disliked about the product. The first is the product is very slick. As I was stretching, my foot slipped right off. The second was the stretcher is too small I have a size 9 shoe and my foot barley fit.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Really high quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is made with really high quality plastic. I don't think it is possible to break this thing. A nice surprise was that it came with a massage ball to roll your feet on. The only thing is that I feel like I need some padding on my heel if I want to use this stretcher without shoes or socks. Other than that, this is great. I recommend for anyone wanting to stretch the bottom of your feet or calves.
customer_reviews.author: Deedee

customer_reviews.title: I think it's going to help
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband who gets extreme leg cramps at times. He was instructed to stretch his legs but he doesn't do it often enough. He's decided using this while he watches tv is a good idea. I have used it too and find that it helps my feet. It seems quite sturdy and seems like it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: S.m.o.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Stretch
customer_reviews.text: My son fractured his leg and part of physical therapy is a calf stretch. He wasn't getting a deep enough stretch at home so we purchased this so we could do his daily exercises. It works great, my son loves it and I have been using it well. It is easy to use and gets a nice deep stretch. Also my son is 5'3 and 100lbs and I am 5'5 and 280lbs
customer_reviews.author: brittany

customer_reviews.title: No More Nighttime Muscle Spasms!
customer_reviews.text: I first used one of these in therapy when I sprained mt foot. I was amazed at how good it made my foot and calf feel! After I left therapy, I ordered this one. It amazing! As a bonus, it came with a free spiked ball to roll around under your foot to massage the tendon.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Rayburntrobaugh

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been struggling with plantar fasciitis on and off for years. I have seen many doctors, and taken all the pills, shots. Done the inner soles and bought the best tennis shoes. They all help to some degree, but not enough to get real relief. This rocker really helps. I Have only been using it for a few days and I can see real improvement. I will be stretching with this every day.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie P

customer_reviews.title: Not really non slip, too small for size 13 with shoes
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are using this on carpet its not really non-slip. The tape on the bottom isn't really that tacky and easily slips on my vinyl floor under my work desk. There are definitely softer tackier rubbers that could have been used on the bottom. The small size combined with the slipping make it awkward to consistently use at work.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B. Payne

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and easy to use with shoes
customer_reviews.text: I got it for myself and I use it for the Physical therapy home exercises in recovery from Achilles tendinitis and plantar fasciis. My husband liked it too so he started using it for stretches before martial arts classes. The rocker comes with a spiky ball too that I found very useful (used with shoes!) to massage my arches.
customer_reviews.author: Curatolo Cristina

customer_reviews.title: This thing works
customer_reviews.text: So I was skeptical but took a chance and bought it for my tight leg muscles. Turns out it works. Use it in the morning and in the evening. Simple, easy, but it does stretch the muscles well and the result has been much more range of motion for my legs. I'm 74-years-old and if it works for me imagine it'll work well for anyone else as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ron M.

customer_reviews.title: Give a great stretch.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use! Make sure you use the wall while using this or have a strong chair under you. It's very easy to lose your balance if you are not use to how this product works! Really gives me a great stretch and I am really happy with this purchase. Check out my Instagram @LoveItOrChuckIt for a video of how to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Love It Or Chuck it Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Not sealed pkg - but GREAT PRODUCT - fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Works great, super sturdy. Heel pocket works MUCH better if you line it with a shoe heel cushion - packaging wasn’t sealed which was very disappointing - had to disinfect the item before using - just in case - wished bought two to do both feel while sitting - will buy another - and will request sealed packaging :)
customer_reviews.author: Frugalladytoo

customer_reviews.title: Works for what is is designed for.
customer_reviews.text: I have Plantar Fasciitis and tried to live with it. After more than a year I went to a foot and ankle doctor and he gave me shots in my heel and designed an orthotic to insert into my shoe. The orthotic was expensive. He showed me some exercises to do with my foot. I looked into some type of device that would do the same exercise without stairs or wall or other stable items, This VIVE Foot Rocker does the trick. It is well made and easy to use. I am very pleased. The only problem is my 8 year old grand daughter continues to play with it. A GREAT PROBLEM TO HAVE.
customer_reviews.author: W. Michael Guffy

customer_reviews.title: A little annoying but good!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to stretch because of extreme heel pain. I LOVE the ball accessory. It's a little annoying to have to put on shoes but that's okay. You definitely need something to learn on if your pain is bad. Isn't that great sitting and I'm afraid of loosing my footing using it standing. overall its helpful though
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.text: I give this a low rating because I bought it to use for my plantar fasciitis being the reviews were so great for this issue Well I got absolutely no relief from using it at all. Unfortunately I would recommend this if your suffering from planter fasciitis!!
customer_reviews.author: pe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Stretcher
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to get this, I do Squat lifting 2-3 times a week. Periodically during the winter, I would wake up with some stiffness in the calves. By having this help a great deal, after the first use felt so great and so relieved. Now everyone in my house, my wife and kids use it every morning when they wake up for 2 mins stretch each leg.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Moncher

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: This product seems sturdy and inexpensive, but I don't feel like I can get a better stretch out of it. Maybe you need a smaller or larger foot than my 11.5? It works, but I feel like I can stretch much better on my own.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: So simple to treat my plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: The first time I needed to treat plantar fasciitis, I lived in a two-story townhouse and was able to use the edge of a stair for exercise. I now live in a single story home and needed an exercise device. The foot rocker is an inexpensive, easy to use device that has allowed me to exercise multiple times a day. By using the foot rocker for a week, I have been able to significantly reduce the pain in my heel.
customer_reviews.author: B Farkas

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Item is as described. Sturdy plastic material. I use it on my treadmil platform so that I can use the bars on my treadmil for balance as I don't have any wall space to touch for balance. It does come with instructions, however, I watched some youtube videos to get a better grasp on how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Where was this all my life..
customer_reviews.text: I rarely ever review but... Simple, yet amazing product! There's a reason why Podiatrists won't tell us flat footers of this amazing combo -they'll be out of business. If you'd rather solve/prevent your flat feet pain once and for all instead of paying doctors hundreds or thousands in treatment & up sold products, get this!! This is by far the best and most comfortable stretch my calves ever had. The only way to treat & prevent flat feet pain is to properly stretch the calf muscles, mine felt like rocks before. Just after a few days of using these my feet finally feel relaxed and "normal." I can even see a bit of an arch now.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Soto

customer_reviews.title: Helps maximize stretching feet/calves reduce pain/spasms
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent way to stretch out your muscles to avoid many problems with feet and painful muscle spasms in your calves that leave you with sore aching calves. For safety suggest using chair or holding onto the wall for balance. Do one foot at a time. Does the trick for maximum amount of stretching targeting all areas. Recommend. Must use with sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing calf stretcher
customer_reviews.text: Great product helps you stretch your calves all the way around, came with a great sturdy ball to massage out any build up. I won't go back to regular stretching this is so efficient. I notice a difference how better my calves feel before and after running/working out now with proper stretching.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Fairbairn

customer_reviews.title: Great product,  great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I was diagnosed with Achilles tendonitis and was doing PT. They had me use this rocker, and it worked so well that I brought one for my house. This works great and it's very sturdy, and it also comes with a hard rubber ball with spikes for you to roll/massage your feet. This was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly R

customer_reviews.title: Great foot stretchers at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: I had a severe comminuted heel bone fracture on my right foot Almost a year ago. I developed Achilles tendinitis. it is very painful. It been a week since I got the foot rocker. I been stretching my foot on it. I already feel It is strengthening My tendon which decreases my pain. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lilian Suarez

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought this ages ago
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these devices when I had physical therapy for my ankle and it really helped with my recovery after surgery. I had thought about purchasing one for continuing to work on stretching and range of motion at home, but never pulled the trigger. I bought this recently to help with an overuse injury and some strain on my ankle, and it's been fantastic! I have noticed a huge difference in how I am able to recover after runs and my ankle feels a lot stronger. The little ball it comes with is great for working out little sore spots as well. I wish I had bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon S

customer_reviews.title: This product was recommended by my physical therapist
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by my physical therapist. I'm suffering from severe shin splints that have developed into chronic tendinitis down into both feet. They told me to buy one and use it every day to stretch feet and calves. Takes a bit of getting used to (my PT showed me how to use it), but so far so good; I think it's helping. Fast delivery, too.
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: you can feel it
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my son and myself. My boy has very tight calves and my legs get tight from work. You can feel the stretch nd release of the muscles when you use this. It will take some time for my growing boy to stretch out his calves but with time I'm certain this will help.
customer_reviews.author: Mom in NH

customer_reviews.title: Must be a child's foot in the photo
customer_reviews.text: The product is good. It's sturdy and comes as advertised. The one drawback is the size/range of motion. While I do get a decent stretch while using it, I expected the stretch to be more. The reason is that even though it's advertised as 1 size fits all, my foot, which is not that big (men size 10) reaches over the edge. So because a lot of my foot isn't on it, I don't get the full stretch I was looking for. I don't know who they have showing in the picture, but that person must have a size 6 female shoe. That being said, the product does what it claims to do, so worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

product_meta.title: Vive Foot Rocker - Calf Stretcher for Achilles Tendinitis, Heel, Feet, Shin Splint, Plantar Fasciitis Pain Relief - Stretches Strained Leg Muscle - Ankle Wedge Stretch Improves Flexibility
feature_bullets: EFFECTIVELY STRETCH FOOT: Safely stretch either foot with the Vive foot rocker. Ergonomically designed, the gentle motion of the foot rocker evenly stretches the foot to relieve pain, improve circulation and reduce fatigue. Additionally, the foot stretcher isolates the lower leg muscles, tendons and ligaments for an effective deep stretch to reduce injuries.

REDUCE FOOT & HEEL PAIN: Reducing foot pain from plantar fasciitis, Achilles tendonitis, ankle strain, arch pain, and other chronic conditions, the foot rocker encourages correct foot posture for effective stretching. Increasing range of motion and flexibility, the safe, even foot stretches also minimize heel, leg and back discomfort.

ANTI-SLIP ROCKER DESIGN: Nonslip rubber strips along the bottom of the foot rocker ensures the stretcher does not slide when used on any surface. A raised heel plate locks the heel in place while nonslip treads prevent the foot from slipping while in use.

ERGONOMIC FOOT PLATE: Designed to ensure proper foot posture for safe and effective stretching, the foot stretcher has an angled foot plate with slip-resistant treads. Designed with a mid-foot gap, the foot rocker can also be used for ankle strengthening.
VIVE LIFETIME GUARANTEE: Money back guarantee. We stand behind our products and ensure your satisfaction.
